title.narrative: National Program Support for Tax Administration Reform.

description.narrative: To increase taxpayer compliance by increasing the efficiency and effectiveness of the BIR, and to prepare the BIR for a sustainable and long-term reform.

title.narrative: Increase in the number of new registered taxpayers

comment.narrative: 1.3 million over 2004-2005
Annual increase of at least 5%
End 2010 number: 2,097,654End 2011 number: 2,228,518Annual increase: 6.2%

title.narrative: Increase in the number of accounts receivable settled and improved settlement process

comment.narrative: P 4.5 billion from 2003 to August 2006
10 percent annual reduction in outstanding accounts receivable
Not available

comment.narrative: The data is from 2010; actual date within 2010 not known
Finalization of Terms of Reference for Taxpayers Survey for scheduled for 2nd review of BAC. Target date of conduct- 4Q 2012 to1Q2013

title.narrative: A unified and integrated/comprehensive registration system with improved up-to-date taxpayer information

target.value: A single database for all taxpayers

title.narrative: Increase in the use of performance management system for office and staff appraisal and development

baseline.value: PMS developed and piloted in LTS and some office

target.value: Institutionalization of a PMS for all offices and individuals

comment.narrative: Institutionalization of a PMS for all offices and individuals

actual.value: Management uses individual KPIs to assess individual performance, but those are too linked to collection targets and do notprovideenough weight to institutional development factors as reflected in the agency-level KPIs. Since agency-level KPIs wererecently adopted, unit and individual KPIs need to be re-worked to be aligned with them. 22. BIR is planning to develop aperformance managementinformation system that goes down to the individual staff level. At the moment, such a system has only beendeveloped for the LTS, but the planning and management services unit is working to extend it to the whole BIR. The planning unit isin charge of linking the data for the unit/office level to the individual level one these indicators have been developed by HR.

comment.narrative: Attrition Law continues to set the perverse incentives of evaluating staff and unit performance almost exclusively according tocollection targets.
